file_content.text: Major, good. Now that you've arrived, we can begin operations in earnest.
Imperial forces, including General Rakton, have invaded Corellia in full force. Local resistance fighters have barely held them back from total victory.
Havoc calling General Garza. Objective complete. The Bastion gate is secure.
I'm very relieved to hear that, Major. I was worried that everything we'd worked for might have amounted to nothing.
Excellent work, Major. Everything we've fought so hard to achieve is finally within reach.
Our forces will rendezvous with you inside the Bastion shortly. Once they do, the operation will be in your hands.
I cannot lead this final push from the outside, Major. I'm counting on you to assess Rakton's defenses and lead our forces to victory.
I won't let you down, General.
Understood.
It will be an honor to lead this operation.
Thank you very much.
Honor isn't part of the equation. You aren't there to lead a gallant charge; you're there to win--no matter what.
Nice to know you finally trust me to command more than five people.
It's about time.
Drop the sarcasm, Major. A field commander has no time for it.
Remember: General Rakton is one of the greatest enemies the Republic has ever faced. He is a very dangerous man, both mentally and physically.
He plans to use the information in the Bastion's databanks to command an unstoppable campaign against us. You must not fail.
General Rakton won't defeat me, General.
I won't.
I've gotten us this far, General. I'm not stopping now.
Don't sweat it.
Just be sure your confidence doesn't lead you to underestimate the situation.
I'm going to cut a path of destruction straight into Rakton's face.
Nothing will stand in my way.
Discretion is just as important as aggression. Don't lose sight of the overall tactical situation.
The finest military units available are under your command now. Your Republic is counting on you to put them to good use.
Good luck, Major. Garza out.
Good luck, Major.
Before the full assault can begin, your team must complete two final objectives. The first is to block General Rakton's communications.
Once Havoc has placed signal jammers at key locations outside the Bastion walls, we can cut off all comm traffic.
Hopefully this will minimize any surprise Imperial backup.
Good, no enemy reinforcements.
Hopefully it will prevent Imperial backup entirely.
If the Empire's top general drops off comms, they're going to notice.
That could raise alarms.
Based on the comm traffic we've measured so far, we're confident you'll have enough time to complete your objectives before anyone notices the blackout.
Can't the forces we brought in help with this stuff?
Why am I doing all the work?
Backup was brought in to help with the assault, not the preparations for the assault.
When the jammers are in position, Havoc can proceed to the second objective--breaching the Bastion gate.
The gate is effectively impervious to frontal assault, so you'll need to commandeer an Imperial crawler tank and use it to pass through undetected.
Consider it done, General.
Understood.
I'm always up for joyriding in a hundred-tonne war machine.
Sounds like fun.
Try not to get carried away.
Grabbing a crawler isn't exactly a walk in the park.
Easier said than done.
If you find hijacking an Imperial crawler your most difficult task on Corellia, I'll be very disappointed.
Scouts have spotted a crawler operating at these coordinates with a minimal escort. It's your best bet.
Once you've ridden the crawler through the Bastion gate, you'll secure the gate controls, then contact me via holo to begin the final assault. Is everything clear?
Plant jammers outside the gate, hijack the crawler, secure the gate controls. Clear.
Affirmative, General.
Run me through the objectives one more time, please.
I could use a review.
First, plant the jammers outside the Bastion. Then, hijack an Imperial crawler and pass through the gate. Contact me when the gate is secure.
This is your most ridiculous plan yet, Garza.
Clearly suicidal, yes.
And the best plan available to us, Major.
Time is tight--that crawler won't be in the field forever. Set your jammers and get there as quickly as possible--don't let anything slow you down.
Dismissed. And good luck.
Major, excellent work. The Safecrackers and the Fifty-third Armored have already touched down, and the extra dropships you captured are bringing in the Eighty-first Infantry.
Major, good work. Captain Phaeris's crews have already touched down with the Safecrackers and the Fifty-third Armored. They're approaching the Bastion now.
Our strategy has unfolded perfectly. Now, it's time to put the final phase into motion.
Havoc Squad is ready for action, General!
Let's go!
Are we ready to hit the Bastion with everything we've got?
Full-frontal assault?
Not yet, but we will be soon.
The Imps had better start interviewing for a new head general.
Rakton's as good as dead.
We're very close now, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.
What are you doing here, Major? Scans still show Imperial sensors active in Axial Park.
Havoc Squad calling General Garza. Operation complete. Landing zone is clear.
Excellent work, Major. I'll let Captain Phaeris know immediately.
Yeah, and be sure to let her know how you got this VIP landing pad. She'll be thrilled.
And you seemed like a decent person... I'm just glad my part in all of this is over now.
I could tell you were trouble right from the start. At least my part in this is done.
What do you mean, your part is done?
You're leaving?
It means I was here to help you get your troops on the ground, and I have. So now I'm leaving.
This op has been a lot messier than I would've liked.
I really am sorry.
Oh, I'm really sorry to hear that.
Without you around, we can finally get something done.
Good riddance.
I just hope you do half as much damage to Rakton as you did getting to him. So long.
Havoc Squad calling General Garza. Operation complete. Lucky Lancer has cleared the landing area.
I'm glad to hear it, Major.
You've done a great thing today. You've saved something that could never be replaced.
I can see that you're not just in it to win, you're in it to win the right way.
I can't say I agree with every move you've made, but you took a big risk for us on this one. It's appreciated.
I'm just glad I could help.
It was nothing.
So am I, believe me.
Where do we go from here?
What's next?
Just be sure you remember this down the road, Locke.
You owe me.
What, a Corellian forget a debt? Not a chance.
Now that you're getting your backup, I'd say my part is done. Been a pleasure working with you, Major--Rakton doesn't have a chance.
It's been a pleasure working with you, too.
Thanks.
See you around.
We could use a guy like you when we hit the Bastion.
Stick around and help.
That's best left to the younger generation, and I'm needed elsewhere. Best of luck to you.
I'm glad to hear you won't be wasting any more of my time.
Good riddance.
Charming--I miss you already. Best of luck.
I'm relocating to a Republic safe house in the Drall Library for the final phase of our plan, Major.
Before you report here, sweep the area around the museum for any Imperial sensor emplacements. We can't afford to have our plans discovered now. Garza out.
Get those pilots to the museum ASAP, Major. We don't have much time.
Move quickly, Major. There isn't much time.
Captain Phaeris is returning with our forces, and we need to clear them a place to land.
The best bet here in Axial Park is the Corellian Museum of Starships--they have a big, open-air landing pad that our people can slip right onto.
Unfortunately, that landing pad is occupied by a famous Corellian warship, the Lucky Lancer. We need you to deal with it.
How exactly do you want me to "deal with it," General?
I'm not quite following you.
Are you asking me to destroy this thing, General?
You want me to blow it up?
I believe that would be the wisest course of action, yes.
What do you want me to do with some busted old ship?
Antiques aren't my specialty.
I'd prefer you simply destroy it, but Locke seems to feel it's very valuable.
The Lucky Lancer is the most famous Corellian ship in the galaxy! We can't just blow it up to clear a parking spot!
Look, I've got volunteers ready and willing to fly the Lancer out and hide it someplace safe. All you have to do is escort them to the museum.
Escort missions are risky and time-consuming. Destroying the ship is a far better option.
I won't risk the mission just to save one ship.
Agreed--I'll destroy the ship.
We need to keep the people's spirits up. Destroying their history won't do that.
Let's get the ship out safely.
If you feel you can save the ship and still serve our objectives, so be it. But keep it quick.
Thanks, Major. Everyone on Corellia is going to be singing your praises for saving that ship.
Okay, people. The major will escort you to the museum--keep your heads down, follow orders and get the Lancer out of there.
Yes, sir!
This hike could get pretty exciting--just leave the fighting to me. Let's go.
Hope you're ready.
I don't slow down for anything, so don't get left behind. Let's go.
Try to keep up.
Follow me!
Let's move!
Think you can handle detonating a priceless piece of Corellian history?
Vik, prep your explosives.
Only if I get to take credit every time we run into a Corellian from now on.
Blasting this thing is going to be a lot of fun.
I do love a good detonation.
You know what? I give up on you people. It's like you're in a race with the Imps to do the most damage.
I thought you weren't like her, Major. I thought you'd get it. Guess I was wrong.
I'm here to protect the whole Republic, not just Corellia.
The mission comes first.
You're just taking the easy way out.
I never wanted it to be this way.
I'm sorry, Locke.
Don't waste your apologies on me.
We can't win this war with one hand tied behind our backs!
You need to face reality.
What's the point of winning if we destroy everything we have in the process?
Enough. We don't have time for this. Major, here are the explosives. Be sure to report in when the job is done.
Major, good. Let's get straight to it.
Havoc Squad calling General Garza. Objective complete. The ambush was a success.
Excellent news, Major. Rakton will think twice about sending reinforcements that way again.
Locke and I have relocated to a Republic safe house in Axial Park.
Report here immediately for new orders. Our forces will be arriving soon, and we need to clear them a safe landing zone.
I'm on my way, General.
Copy that.
Very good. Garza out.
What's wrong with the blast-field shipyard?
They can't land where I did?
The force is too large to move from there to the Bastion unnoticed. We need to land them closer to the actual mission area.
I'll give you the full details when you arrive. Garza out.
Reporting in is a waste of time. Run me through the op now.
Just give me the details now.
We can't trust the comms, Major. Get here on the double. Garza out.
Move out, Major.
General Rakton means to assault the Republic and resistance positions in this sector. He's deployed a massive infantry force.
The main part of Rakton's force is going to move through a factory in Labor Valley--a great place for an ambush.
I'll make the Imps wish they'd never left home.
Count me in.
Has Rakton found out that we're here?
Do they know about Havoc?
We don't believe so. This appears to be a standard infantry sweep, not any kind of specialized hunting party.
Can't the forces here defend themselves?
Why risk showing ourselves?
This isn't the most defensible spot on Corellia. We need to hit the Imps in transit, before they can form up and attack.
We've got three resistance cells hiding out in Labor Valley, all ready and willing to help out. Their coordinates are right here.
Meet with each cell and tell them that the operation is beginning, then rendezvous with them all on the factory floor. Understood?
I'll make it happen, General.
Understood.
Sounds like fun.
Untrained irregulars will just get in my way.
Let me handle this alone.
I guarantee that every man and woman there has seen their share of gunfights. They won't disappoint you.
When you meet with each cell, tell them "blazing spear is go." They'll know what to do.
Once the operation is complete, contact me via holo. Good luck.
As you may already know, access to Labor Valley is limited by an Imperial blockade. General Aves is working on a solution.
If you haven't already spoken to General Aves or his assistant, Corporal Hartke, do so. You'll find them at the spaceport. Dismissed.
Access to Labor Valley is currently cut off by an Imperial blockade.
General Aves will know how to deal with it. His assistant, Corporal Hartke, can point you to him--you'll find Hartke in the spaceport. Dismissed.
Major. Captain Phaeris reports that she and her fellow pilots successfully navigated the Imperial blockade. They'll rendezvous with our forces shortly.
I'm getting a dozen holocalls a minute from our people in the residential district. Havoc Squad's got a few hundred new fans on Corellia.
I only did what had to be done.
It was nothing.
You put your neck out to save defenseless people--our people. Corellians don't forget a thing like that.
You need to get those people somewhere secure.
They should go somewhere safe.
We're already on it. The Imps won't get a second shot at any of them.
Be sure my fans know that Havoc is happy to accept gifts.
Tell them to send credits.
Don't be ridiculous. We've wasted enough time as it is.
Ah, Major, good work out there. Captain Phaeris and her private fleet have breached the Imperial blockade. They're approaching our forces now.
And in the meantime, we've got more bodies in those burned-out buildings than we can count! What do I tell those people's families?
I didn't want this to happen, but there was no choice.
I'm sorry, Locke.
You had a choice. You chose to let those people die.
Those bombings are nothing compared to what Rakton will do if we don't stop him.
Look at the bigger picture.
I'm sure that will make everyone feel much better.
My squad can't be everywhere at once, Locke.
They aren't my problem.
No. But you were close enough to stop this, and you didn't.
Enough. We need to get on with the operation.
Havoc Squad to General Garza. Objective complete. The hangars are clear.
Good work. We'll get Captain Phaeris and her associates on the move right away.
General! Hey, you've got the major on the line, good. We've got a serious problem. Imperial troops are firebombing the residential districts.
The people still hiding there won't have a chance. You've got to move fast, Major. Take the Imperials out before it's too late.
I'll move out right away.
You can count on me.
Not so fast. We need to consider the overall operation before we act.
General, what are your orders on this?
That's up to Garza.
I have a different strategy in mind.
I'm here to take out Rakton. Period.
Not part of my mission, Locke.
Agreed. This situation offers us a much better tactical opportunity.
While the Imperials are wasting time with the residential area, Havoc can slip behind them and eliminate the men guarding their dropships.
Once the dropships are secured, Captain Phaeris's associates can hijack them and bring in more troops for our assault on the Bastion.
Are you ordering me to clear out the dropships, General?
Is that an order?
Your call, Major. But if we allow ourselves to be distracted by every small-scale raid, we'll never reach Rakton.
It's more important to save lives than dropships.
We should stop the fires.
We will save more lives by stopping Rakton than by stopping this raid. We need to focus.
I'm up for anything that gives us a better shot at Rakton.
More troops sounds good to me.
But those are families' homes... there's no telling how many people are still hiding out in there!
Look how long it's taken Coruscant to recover. We can't let that happen again. Not here.
I have to do what's best for the mission.
We need those dropships.
The mission is to protect the people of the Republic!
If I can help these people, I have to try.
I'll save the civilians.
Thank you, Major. Corellia really needs people like you.
Return to base when you've finished. Garza out.
You're letting personal feelings cloud your judgment, Locke.
Fires aren't my problem.
Personal feelings? I don't think it's personal to want the planet intact when you're done fighting Rakton!
Enough. The matter is settled. Return to base when you've eliminated the guards around the Imperial dropships, Major. Garza out.
You have your orders, Major.
This is Locke, the CorSec officer I was telling you about. His associate is Captain Phaeris, a contract pilot who's volunteered to help us.
As I've explained, breaching the Bastion will require substantial manpower. Captain Phaeris and her associates will be responsible for bringing that manpower to Corellia unnoticed.
If you can get our people here without the Imps noticing, we'll be in good shape.
Sounds good.
It's what we do best. Just have to clear up one tiny detail, and we'll be ready to jet.
Resistance is going to be heavy.
It's going to be dangerous.
Everyone in my crew can slip a blockade in their sleep. That's the least of our worries.
Are we so low on troop transports that we're hiring smugglers now?
That doesn't make any sense.
Hey. Not a nice thing to say about someone in front of a police official.
If we bring our forces down in our own transports, Rakton will realize that we're making our move. We need the element of surprise.
Besides, my people know the ins and outs of this town a lot better than yours do. There's really just one downside.
The landing bays where the volunteers' ships are docked have been captured by Imperial forces. We need Havoc Squad to clear them out--fast. Understood?
The ships will be freed up in no time.
Understood.
Music to my ears.
We're getting their ships out, and they're helping us in return, right?
So it's a favor for a favor?
What do you take us for? This is our home, and we're not about to let the Imps get their grimy claws on it.
Clearing security is kid's stuff, you don't need Havoc.
This is a waste of my time.
These are first-rate Imperial commandos, and our time frame is limited. It's a job for Havoc.
There's your coordinates, Major--I look forward to seeing Havoc at work.
Good luck, Major. Dismissed.
I'm not saying we're not on board, lady, I'm saying you're not the boss of me. Wouldn't kill you to show some respect.
This is war. If you can't join ranks and follow orders, then you're a liability.
Everybody just take it easy, all right? We're all on the same side. Now, General, it looks like your best and brightest is here--why don't we get started?
You're the Corellian Security officer, right?
You must be Locke.
It's CorSec around here, so yeah, that's me. It's a pleasure.
Locke's associate is Captain Phaeris, a contract pilot. She's leading a group of private ship owners who have volunteered to help our cause.
What are you all arguing about?
What's going on here?
Questioning authority. Standard operating procedure around here.
Sounds like we're off to a great start.
Bickering already?
Great minds don't always think alike.
Corellia is the tipping point for the entire war. If the Imperials win here, they could reverse all our hard-fought advances.
Corellia won't fall to the Empire on my watch.
Then we'll stop them.
If we beat the Imps here, will that be the end of it?
What if we win?
Not right away. But winning here should put an overall victory well within our reach.
I'll crush the Imps here just like I've crushed them everywhere else.
I never lose.
We're all counting on it.
Your target is the Bastion, one of the main centers for logistics and strategic planning in the entire Republic.
Rakton seized the Bastion during the invasion--he's clearly hoping to use the information inside to plan his next campaign against us. It's your job to stop him.
Just tell me where to begin, General.
Understood.
How could Rakton capture such an important objective?
How did this happen?
Corellia's leadership betrayed us--practically sold their planet to the Empire.
If Rakton's in the Bastion, let's just flatten it from orbit.
Why not slag the whole place?
Unfortunately, even our most concentrated fire would barely make a dent.
The Bastion is one of the most heavily secured fortresses in the galaxy. Your team will need a lot of support to take it.
To get the necessary manpower into the field, we're working with a local resistance leader--a Corellian Security officer named Locke.
Local intel can make a big difference.
Sounds good.
What do we know about this guy, General?
Tell me about Locke.
A great deal, actually.
Havoc can pull this off fine on our own, Garza.
We don't need locals.
I'm afraid not, Major. Besides, this contact isn't like most others.
Before he entered CorSec, Locke served in Special Forces under my command. He's a dependable soldier, and he knows Corellia very well.
We'll discuss the details once you arrive. We've set up our command center in a former cantina, the Gilded Descent.
I'll move out right away, General.
Will do.
I never thought I'd see you inside a cantina, General.
Are we going for a drink?
Very funny.
Can't we do better than some old dive?
Sounds pathetic.
We make due with what's available.
Watch for targets of opportunity, Major. Imperial commando teams are all over the area.
See you soon. Garza out.
Major.
We'll hang back and stay out of sight while you clear a path, then catch up inside the museum. Good hunting!
